qas.question: Jules Ferry thought that the "higher races" have a duty to what?

answers.text: sent small numbers of settlers to its colonies

qas.question: The French thought bringing what would uplift other regions?
Where did the French send a large number of settlers?

context: It became a moral justification to lift the world up to French standards by bringing <a3_0><a3_1><a3_2><a3_3><b8_0>Christianity<a3_1/> and French culture<b8_0/><a3_3/><a3_2/><a3_0/>. In 1884 the leading exponent of colonialism, Jules Ferry declared France had a civilising mission: "The higher races have a right over the lower races, they have a duty <a0_3>to <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2><a0_4><b5_0>civilize<a0_4/> the inferior<b5_0/><a0_3/><a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/>". <a1_1><a1_4>Full citizenship rights<a1_4/><a1_1/> – ‘’<a1_0><a1_2><a1_3>assimilation<a1_3/><a1_2/><a1_0/>’’ – were offered, although in reality <b6_0>assimilation<b6_0/> was always on the distant horizon. Contrasting from Britain, France <a2_1><a2_2><a2_3>sent <a2_0><a2_4><b7_0>small numbers of settlers<b7_0/><a2_4/><a2_0/> to its colonies<a2_3/><a2_1/>,<a2_2/> with the only notable exception of <a4_0><a4_1><a4_2><a4_3>Algeria<a4_3/><a4_2/><a4_1/><a4_0/>, where French settlers nevertheless always remained a small minority.
